question: How many students may be on a team?
answer: Teams must consist of 4 members. Teams with less or more students will not be accepted.

question: Can I participate in SM3 remotely?
answer: No, SM3 will be entirely in-person on October 25th, 2025.

question: Do students on the same team have to be from the same school?
answer: It is recommended that students form schools teams but not required.

question: What schools or organizations can participate in SM3?
answer: SM3 2025 will be open to all domestic students from US-based schools.

question: Are calculators allowed?
answer: No. Calculators are not allowed on any portion of the tests. Check the SMT rules for information on permitted items.

question: What topics may appear on the tests? How hard are the tests?
answer: Tests will primarily cover topics taught through standard seventh grade math curricula. The hardest problems will be similar in difficulty to MATHCOUNTS state-level problems.

question: Do we need to have a teacher or coach attend SM3 in person?
answer: Yes, you must have at least one authorized adult chaperone present per team who is responsible for the team during the event.

question: Can I use the problems from previous SM3 tests listed below in my classroom/book/etc?
answer: Yes! Feel free to use any officially released problems, provided you cite us in the format 'Stanford Mini Math Meet [Year] [Round] [Problem #]'
